headline.title: Help us improve the COVID-19 exposure notification app

content.text: The Corona-Warn-App open-source project develops a tracking app based on technology with a decentralized approach that notifies users if they have been exposed to COVID-19. It maintains the highest security and data privacy standards to protect the end-users and encourage adoption.

image-ticker.title: Track nearby IDs
image-ticker.text: In a background process an IoS/Android SDK registers (rolling) identifiers from phones in the vicinity using Bluetooth Low Energy and stores them locally – encrypted and inaccessible.

image-ticker.title: Communicate test result of user with symptoms
image-ticker.text: Tested user can get results communicated in the app, through a test results server using an authentication process with QR-codes.

image-ticker.title: Distribute list of COVID-19 positive identifiers
image-ticker.text: In case of a positive test result, the user is asked to voluntarily upload the anonymous identifiers to the key server. To prevent misuse, it first verifies the positive test result. If confirmed, the key server adds the anonymous identifiers to the COVID-19-confirmed identifiers list, which is regularly broadcasted to all apps.

image-ticker.title: Check for previous contact with COVID-19 positive identifier
image-ticker.text: The SDK checks if any of the broadcasted list of COVID-19-confirmed identifiers was registered as being in the vicinity of that device. In case of exposure the risk is assessed, and the user receives corresponding instructions.

boxes.title: The Corona-Warn-App Blog is comming soon

headline.title: Join the open-source project!
textblock: If you want to contribute, head over to GitHub to get started.
Learn about our Code of Conduct and find out how to contribute on the Community page.

headline.title: Our partners
headline.text:
The German government has requested SAP and Deutsche Telekom to deliver the official Corona-Warn-App for Germany fully based on open source.
There are many more partners involved in creating this app as well as the global open source community.

headline.title: Get the App!
headline.text: Now available via App Store and Google Play Store.
